title: Thepla brand marketing + catalog website with brand story, product category sliders, cart, and contact/FAQ pages

requirements.text: Create a responsive multi-page website for a thepla brand with a clear home page narrative flow and dedicated pages/sections for Home, Categories, Cart, Notifications, Account, FAQ, and Contact.

quotes: Create a website for a thepla brand
Add at the bottom Home Categories Cart Notification Account

acceptanceCriteria: App loads with working navigation to: Home, Categories, Cart, Notifications, Account, FAQ, Contact.
Pages render well on mobile and desktop (no horizontal overflow; readable typography).

requirements.text: Add an editable branding header area that leaves space for the user to set/replace the brand name and logo (including a visible placeholder when unset).

quotes: leave space for me to edit logo and brand name

acceptanceCriteria: Header shows a logo placeholder and brand name placeholder by default.
User can edit brand name text in the UI and see it reflected across the site during the session.
User can upload/select a logo image in the UI and see it in the header during the session (no backend required).

requirements.text: Add a "Brand Story" section on the Home page using the provided narrative text (verbatim, with appropriate paragraph formatting) and make it visually prominent.

quotes: Starting add story of the brand Some memories never fade...

acceptanceCriteria: Brand Story section appears on Home and contains the full provided story text, formatted into readable paragraphs.
Text is presented in English and is not truncated.

requirements.text: Add a separate Home page section titled in English that explains how the brand supports/creates "Griha Mahila Udyog" (women working from home, financial independence), aligned with the intent of the user’s request and consistent with the story tone.

quotes: Write a story how brand inculcates Griha mahila udyog we are planning

acceptanceCriteria: Section is present on Home and written in English.
Content clearly explains the at-home women empowerment model and ties back to the brand mission.

requirements.text: Implement a Categories page (and/or Categories section) that displays thepla products grouped into these categories with per-category slider/carousel browsing, showing product name, pack size, and price with the Indian Rupee symbol (₹): Long Duration (3 Months): Masala Thepla ₹40 (Piece of 4), Methi Thepla ₹45–₹50 (Piece of 4), Til Thepla ₹48 (Piece of 4); Short Duration (1 Day): Dudhi Thepla ₹60 (Piece of 4), Spinach Thepla ₹68 (Piece of 4); Diet Conscious: Multigrain Thepla ₹165 (Piece of 5), Bajra + Wheat Thepla ₹95 (Piece of 5), Nachani Thepla ₹128 (Piece of 5).

quotes: Add products of brand in categorize form
give each category product in a slider format view

acceptanceCriteria: Categories are displayed exactly as: Long Duration (3 Months), Short Duration (1 Day), Diet Conscious.
Each category renders products in a horizontal slider/carousel that can be navigated on mobile (swipe/scroll) and desktop (buttons or scroll).
Each product card shows: unbranded realistic product image, product name, pack size text, and price using ₹.
Methi Thepla price is displayed as a range (₹45–₹50) rather than a single value.

requirements.text: Add an "Other Products" section with a slider/carousel showing items with realistic unbranded images and ₹ pricing where provided. Include at minimum: Lime ₹95 (500g), Mango ₹110 (500g), and also list: Chilli (500g), Awla (500g), Carrot (500g), Chunda (500g), Thecha (500g). Quantity must be user-customizable per item (e.g., selectable/enterable quantity and/or weight), without requiring backend.

quotes: Other products use slider for the product to view add realistic image no brand mentioned Quantity can Be customizable

acceptanceCriteria: Other Products section uses a horizontal slider/carousel on mobile and desktop.
Items with prices show ₹95 and ₹110 respectively; items without prices do not show a fake price.
Each item shows its (500g) pack size label.
Each item provides a quantity control (e.g., stepper) that changes the selected quantity for cart actions during the session.

requirements.text: Implement basic cart functionality: users can add items from any slider to a Cart page, adjust quantities, and remove items. Cart should compute line totals and a grand total using ₹ and persist locally in the browser.
acceptanceCriteria: Add-to-cart action exists on product cards.
Cart page lists added items with quantity controls and remove option.
Grand total updates correctly when quantities change.
Cart contents persist across page refresh using local storage (or equivalent browser storage).

requirements.text: Add a bottom navigation bar visible on mobile (and optionally desktop) containing: Home, Categories, Cart, Notification, Account; each item must navigate to its respective page/route.

quotes: Add at the bottom Home Categories Cart Notification Account

acceptanceCriteria: Bottom nav is fixed at the bottom on mobile and does not overlap primary content (content has proper padding).
Tapping each nav item navigates to the correct page.
Current page is visually indicated as active.

requirements.text: Create Notifications and Account pages as simple placeholders consistent with the site theme (no authentication required), so navigation destinations are complete and not broken.
acceptanceCriteria: Notifications page renders a non-empty placeholder layout (English).
Account page renders a non-empty placeholder layout (English).
No dead links/routes for these pages.

requirements.text: Add an FAQ page with an FAQ accordion layout containing questions/answers relevant to the brand (shelf life, storage, ingredients/no preservatives, delivery/ordering, women-led production), written in English and consistent with the provided brand story.
acceptanceCriteria: FAQ page exists and is reachable from navigation (header menu, footer, or bottom nav via Account/More).
FAQs are displayed in an accordion where items expand/collapse.
All FAQ text is in English.

requirements.text: Add a Contact page (or prominent Contact section) showing: Contact number 9785674345, Location Mulund East, and fields/placeholders for Email ID and Instagram handle (since values were not provided).
acceptanceCriteria: Contact info displays phone number exactly: 9785674345.
Location displays exactly: Mulund East.
Email and Instagram are shown as placeholders/fields that the user can fill in (no backend required).

requirements.text: Use the Lijjat Papad website as a structural/reference inspiration (sections like legacy/story, women empowerment, quality/trust, product catalog, FAQ, contact) without copying brand names or copyrighted text; ensure this website includes the points requested in this prompt in a cohesive layout.

quotes: For refrence refer website of lijaat papad include all points given by them in their website

acceptanceCriteria: Site layout includes clear sections for legacy/story, women empowerment, and quality/trust alongside product catalog, FAQ, and contact.
No mention of Lijjat Papad as the brand of this site, and no copied text that appears to be from that site.

requirements.text: Establish a cohesive visual theme (colors, typography, spacing, and component styling) appropriate for an Indian homemade food brand (warm, appetizing, traditional-modern blend) and apply it consistently across all pages; avoid blue/purple as primary colors.
acceptanceCriteria: Theme is consistent across pages (buttons, headings, cards, nav).
Primary palette is not blue/purple.
UI looks like a food brand site (warm neutrals/spice tones, tasteful typography).

requirements.text: Add the required generated product images as static assets under frontend/public/assets/generated and render them in product cards; images must be realistic and unbranded (no logos or brand text on packaging).

quotes: add realistic image no brand mentioned image for each product

acceptanceCriteria: All product cards display an image loaded from frontend/public/assets/generated.
Images are realistic and contain no visible brand text/logos.
No images are served from the backend canister.

constraints: Frontend immutable paths must not be edited: frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, frontend/src/components/ui.
Backend must remain single-actor Motoko; only add backend requirements if strictly needed.
Use English for any user-facing text in the build request (and implement user-facing UI text in English).
nonGoals: Implementing online payments or checkout processing.
Third-party authentication (Internet Identity) and user accounts with persistence.
Admin CMS for managing products (products can be hardcoded for this build).
